_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name:   Struktol Company of America

                        201 E. Steels Corners Road

                        Stow, OH  44224-0649

RMP Facility ID:     Initial Submision

Submission Date:   October 9, 2006







                                                                   Risk Management Plan - Ethylenediamine



                                                                              Executive Summary



1.  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



     Struktol Company of America is strongly committed to the prevention of accidental releases of ethylenediamine and the safety  of our employees.  We have a comprehensive release prevention program that covers release prevention and emergency response.  We have an active working relationship with the Cuyahoga Falls Fire Department who provide us with the necessary expertise in both release cleanup and emergency response.



2.  Stationary Source of  the Regulated Substance



     The ethylenediamine is stored in a 10,000 gallon stainless steel storage tank located outside and behind Building 2.  The tank is fully diked to prevent the release of material to the ground.  The tank is vented through a Trigg vapor recovery system.  The maximum amount of ethylenediamine in the tank at any one time is 44,000 pounds.



3.  Worst Case Release and Alternative Release Scenarios



     See RMP Plan



4.  General Accidental Release Prevention Program



     Our facility has taken all necessary steps to comply with the EPA's accidental release requirements as set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  Struktol Company of America has conducted Process Hazard Analysis to identify and control any and all hazards of ethylenediamine.  We have written procedures for the unloading of the material.  All affected employees are trained in SOP for ethylenediamine.  Struktol Company of America will inspect the ethylenediamine tank, piping system and vent system on a five year basis.  Maintenance checks

are performed by qualified personnel.  Compliance checks are performed on an annual basis.



5.  Five Year Accident History



     Struktol Company of America has had no accidental releases in the last five years.



6.  Emergency Response Plan



     Struktol Company of America maintains a written emergency action plan to deal with all aspects of emergency response (including an accidental release of ethylenediamine).  In the event of an accidental release, we will contact the local emergency response agencies and the public.  We also maintain the necessary required submissions of information with the Ohio SERC, Summit County LEPC and the Cuyahoga Falls Fire Department.



7.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety



     We will continue to provide our employees with ongoing training to ensure that they are current with all of the proper and safe procedures for the handling and transfer of ethylenediamine and provide regular inspection and maintenance of all equipment.  Only authorized personnel will make any chnages necessary if a non-compliance is identified.
